author: cmpilato
msg: Provide two new constructs to the Berkeley DB backend:
1.  The idea of an FS-global unique identifier.  We don't need to
have every table managing its own "next-key" thing -- a
globally unique (within the FS, anyway) ID would be just fine.
2.  The use these FSGUIDs to annotate modified node revision data
representations which ultimately employed shared rep storage.
Next step:  actually look for this uniquifier in code that previously
counted on representation keys changing any time a node revision's
New files with interfaces related to filesystem-global unique IDs.
(Node revisions): Update BNF to include new rep key uniquifier bits.
expandability, and now allow the DATA-KEY slot for files to be a
and return a distinct, catchable error in such scenarios.
(svn_fs_base__dag_finalize_edits): If we reuse a rep-key, generate
an FS-global unique ID and stuff it into the node-revision.
the SVN_ERR_FS_ALREADY_EXISTS error thrown which trying to overwrite
